title: King's Wood Kent Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: David Anstiss / Path to the Yew Tree Loop
images.caption: Path to the Yew Tree Loop

images.title: David Anstiss / Woodland Track in King's Wood
images.caption: Woodland Track in King's Wood. This is part of an access track leading through the large wood used for maintenance and for copsing vehicles.

images.title: David Anstiss / Sculpture Trail in King's Wood
images.caption: Sculpture Trail. This part of a trail around the large woods near Challock. It leads of a footpath and horse track through the woods.

images.title: David Anstiss / Sculpture in King's Wood
images.caption: Sculpture. This is part of 'Score for a hole in the ground,2006' by Jem Finer.

images.title: David Anstiss / King's Wood Carpark
images.caption: King's Wood Car park. This car park on White Hill, near Challock provides access into the very large woods. The woods are managed by the Forestry Commission.

images.title: David Anstiss / 'Ring' Artwork in King's Wood
images.caption: 'Ring' Artwork. This sculpture by Rosie Leventon in 2003

images.title: David Anstiss / Stour Valley Arts in King's Wood
images.caption: Stour Valley Arts information board.

description: This large area of woodland near Challock has miles of good walking trails to try. There's a good sized sculpture trail with a series of interesting wooden sculptures and pretty bluebells in the springtime. The ancient woodland is comprised of Sweet Chestnut, Beech, Corsican Pine and Douglas Fir. It's a great place for wildlife with species including fallow deer, adders, nightjars and green woodpeckers. The forest is located just to the east of Challock with a parking area on White Hill Road. It is not too far from Canterbury and Ashford. This route is designed for walkers to explore the sculptures but there are also lots of good cycling trails on the hard forest roads and mountain bike trails in the woods. The North Downs Way also passes through the eastern end of the woods so you can pick up this bridleway section too. If you followed it south you could pay a visit to the pretty Eastwell Park Lake where there are some nice views across the still waters of the scenic lake. There's also a ruined 14th century church and the splendid Eastwell Manor, a former royal residence.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: As you'd imagine the woodland trails are ideal for dog walking. You'll probably see plenty of other owners on your visit.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head north east to Chilham and you can enjoy some lovely riverside trails along the Stour Valley Walk. This will lead you to Denge Wood where there are more serene woodland trails to try. Perry Woods can also be found near here.

display_address: Kings Wood, White Hill, Challock, Boughton Aluph, Ashford, Kent, England, TN25 4AP, United Kingdom
